reviews.title: Top of the Hill
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at Leiwen and found it to be very enjoyable.

reviews.title: Great for children
reviews.text: The bungalow slept 6 although there was just the two of us which gave us plenty of room. The park is constantly refurbishing bungalows and ours was a 'pre-refurb' which was reflected in the price. It had all mod cons - good kitchen, lounge, bathroom facilities and even a parking space and patio (with furniture). Our only issue was that our bungalow was in a hollow surrounded by trees...no direct sunlight after 3pm each day.

reviews.title: relaxing weekend in beautiful surroundings
reviews.text: The park itself is at the top of a hill and and is always kept clean and tidy. The shop provided fresh milk, bread and rolls each day. I would say that the prices were 1 euro per item more expensive than the same item in a supermarket...and the nearest supermarket is in Leiwen town, around 2 miles down the hill.

reviews.title: Hidden Expenses
reviews.text: The restaurant provides a good selection of food, wine and beer and the swimming pool, bowling and mini golf were very busy too.

reviews.title: Lovely place to escape
reviews.text: The view from the park viewpoint is excellent and the shop provides food for the deer.
